poem:
**Unfinished Business**

In the chamber's echo,  
old whispers resurface—  
a peace tabernacle,  
erected on shifting sands.  
Time's anchors drag us,  
toward the same gray,  
where shadows debate cessation,  
life's whisper turning tides.  
Yet here, in this twilight,  
the echo remains—  
unfinished songs,  
half-sung hymns.
